This is one of Gordon Liu's movies that encouraged me to take up weapons. The fighting scenes are excellent and the Shaolin is very good. There is a fighting scene were Liu Kar Liang and Gordon square off. Its just spectacular. This is a Must See Movie.

A Kung Fu Instructor's sun wishes his father would teach him martial arts but he doesn't because the young man [Gordon Liu] is to hot headed. But an expert takes him in as a student and he learns in 3 years and the rest is Great Kung Fu! Get this one Now!

Very simple plot (story line) but the Kung fu is after all the only reason to watch in the first place, that being said it does not disappoint. Action from start to finish.

Decent movie with English dubbing. The kung-fu is pretty well choreographed.  Story is a little weak though.  A young man comes from a family of kung-fu schools, but his father refuses to teach him because the father thinks his son won't be able to control his temper.  The father's kung-fu master took a liking to the son after a police investigator who is a friend of the family saw something in the son that he believes has the quality of a good kung-fu master in the future.  So under the recommendation of this police investigator friend, the father's kung-fu master decides to teach this kid kung-fu being that the father refuses to do so.  However, the police friend was killed by the bad guy whom the police was hunting down.  After two years of kung-fu training, the kid felt he owed the police friend for recommending him a kung-fu master, so he goes to find the bad guy to revenge for his family friend.

This was an absolute surprise among many other jewels of classic, kung fu stories. Very clean and well acted, from beginning to end the story was so thoroughly enjoyable and a welcome shift in motive and outcome apart from what is so prevalent with many of the classic martial arts movies. Sit down and enjoy this one!
